etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Reports of the British Association for the Advancement of Science. From aconite + -ic, after German Aconitsäure aconitic acid

definitions: Of or relating to aconite. Chiefly in "aconitic acid" noun Chemistry a crystalline tricarboxylic acid existing in monkshood, larkspur, and other plants, and also obtained by heating citric acid.
